SubmitterDescription.SubmitterName: International Standards For Cytogenomic Arrays Consortium (ISCA)

SampleDescription.Description: A partial chromosome analysis, which was consistent with chromosome results reported by an outside institution, indicated a mosaic karyotype. There was both a monosomy X cell line and a cell line with an isodicentric chromosome Yp resulting in deletion of distal Yq and duplication of Yp and the proximal portion of Yq. FISH studies (X and Y centromere, SRY, and CTD-2538E11 at Yq11.222) confirmed the two cell lines are each present in a non-cultured sample in approximately 50% of nuclei. This percentage therefore makes the Yp and proximal Yq look like the normal copy number of one by array CGH since there are two copies of the p-arm in the i(Yp) chromosome in one cell line and zero copies of Yp in the monosomy X cell line. The distal Yq deletion observed by array CGH studies did not look mosaic because it is lost in both the i(Yp) and the monosomy X cell lines

ClinicalAssertion.StudyDescription: Copy number variation identified through the course of routine clinical cytogenomic testing in postnatal populations, with clinical assertions as classified by the original submitter.
ClinicalAssertion.Comment: Copy number variation identified through the course of routine clinical cytogenomic testing in postnatal populations, with clinical assertions as classified by the original submitter.
